text: Pint enjoyed at La Mise en Biere - Lausanne. Pours a cloudy orange color forming a small white head with medium retention and some spotty lacings formed and left in the glass. Very flowery and fruity nose. Spicy and sour. Notes of tropical fruits and orange zest. Hints of Simcoe pine. Hints of caramel malts and berries. Slightly sweet upfront. Slightly sour too. Strong notes of passion fruit and lemon. Caramel malts, Brett, berries and pine. Good sourness. Not overwhelming. Light bitterness as expected. Caramel malts, passion fruit and berries in the afteraste. Complex beer. Excellent.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a tulip. Opaque orange with small white head. Aroma is spicy simcoe, medium body, lower carbonation and little lacing. Taste is citrus, herbal hops, and spice. This has a nice richness.

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy orange golden color with large frothy off-white head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of tropical fruit, berries, wheat, brett, grape skin and white wine with some earthy hints. Taste starts with refreshing sour wheat and citrus, following is funky, grassy and herbal, mouthfeel is crisp and dry, while finish is medium bitter. Light to medium body, thin texture and lively carbonation in palate. Almost perfect...

5.5%ABV. Lambic.

Tapped out gold 6)SRM.

Nose is spontan. At the end, chinese lemon preserves.

Mouthfeel is light watery juice. Palate is wheat flour, water biscuits, Chinese lemon preserves on the palate with dry, lemon peel, medicinal, sour.

Finish is dry with some ume. Overall lemon preserves flavor dominates.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Cytrynowa kwasowość, wyraźnie sosnowy aromat.
Bottle at home. Pours orange color, white head. Aroma is sourish, hints of apricot and orange. Taste is medium sour, lightly sweet, apricot, lightly hoppy.
Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a hazy gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is funk, cheese, grass, oak. Medium body, similar flavors to nose, light tartness, nice dry finish, very good.

Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with thick foamy white head that lasts for about a minute. Aroma of citruses, funk, barnyard, some wet leaves, orange, lime, tangerine, inviting. Taste goes from light acidic to moderate sour, with tangerine notes on tongue, with sligth astringent notes. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Very refreshing and drinkable beer.
(bottle) cloudy, bright orange colour with a small white head; aroma of pineapple, green apple, then bit of funk; tart flavour with a long, medium strong sour and hint of bitter finish

Bottle. Hazy gold, lacy white head that laces my plastic hotel cup as I type this review in real time. Rustic funk on the nose. Funky palate, tart citrus, lots of leafy notes, hints of petrol and leather, bone dry. Jeez this is good.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Flaska på Bishops, Örebro. Guldig, disig med litet vitt skum. Fräsch, pigg syra med grönt humle, kryddig, örtig, lite gräsig/jordig, lime, limeskal, limegräs. Lite lättare kropp åt det torrare hållet. Örtig och gräsig med lite beska och humlebett som kickar in i avslutningen. Fräsch och lätt.
Fût, au St Bock. Nez léger, agrumé. Goût léger citronné. Connais moins le genre, mais cest très bien. Goût à redévelopper.
Bottle; pours slightly hazy orange gold with a white head; aroma is tart citrus, yeast, and a touch of biscuit; taste is tart and dry with citrus and malt; finish is also tart and bitter; very good

On tap at Kraftwork, Smell is bursting with lychee and other tropical Asian fruit. Flavor is a bit weirder with lychee, misc herbs, green earth, simcoe and other lightly sour funk. Some wheat and wet oak in the aftertaste.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 3/2/2021. Pours slightly hazy medium golden yellow color with a 2 finger dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big tart lemon, lime, grapefruit, pineapple, orange peel, mango, melon, pepper, light pine, oak, wheat, cracker, hay, straw, light leathery funk, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of citrus/tropical hops, fruity/funky/spicy/acidic yeast, oak, and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart lemon, lime, grapefruit, pineapple, orange peel, mango, melon, pepper, light pine, oak, wheat, cracker, hay, straw, light leathery funk, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Moderate lactic tartness, yeast/tannic oak spiciness, and light pine/grassy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart lemon, lime, grapefruit, pineapple, orange peel, mango, melon, pepper, pine, oak, wheat, cracker, hay, straw, funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical hops, fruity/funky/spicy/acidic yeast, oak, and moderate pale flavors; with a great malt/tart/spiciness balance, and zero puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from tart/spiciness, lightly increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderate crisp, acidic/grainy/bready, and lightly tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.5%. Overall this is a great dry hopped unblended lambic. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical hops, fruity/funky/spicy/acidic yeast, oak, and moderate pale flavors; very smooth, crisp, and quite refreshing to drink with the balanced acidity. This was less acidic and more malty than others in the series, but still had great complexity all around. A very enjoyable offering.

Draft 0.15l at Uiltje Bar Haarlem, The Netherlands. 10.12.2016. Pour it clear golden color with small white head. Aroma straw, barnyard. Taste dry lemonish, herbal, simcoe hops really present, yeasty, pinch of lemon sugary candy at finish, funky as well, medium sourness, medium body, slick feel, fizzy, long finish, dry after taste. Amazing.

Draft at Whole Foods PM. Poured hazy straw with frothy, white head. Nose was hops, mild yeasty funky tartness. Tasted hoppy, with some resiny notes, mild bitterness, florals. Complex and juicy finish.

Bottle. Shaker. Golden, medium hazy with small, off-white head. Poor head retention and lacing. Light to moderate malty aroma,moderate barnyard, leather, brett and citric notes. Moderately sweet, light to moderately acidic (citric), nearly moderately bitter, quite stable with long duration. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is barnyard, crisp, tart, moderately bitter, hoppy, slightly oaky. Summary: Very good brew. Nice funky, brett profile along with decent hoppy character.
I like these dry hopped versions. More like a sour IPA. Lots of funk and sharp brett in there giving a chardonnay feel. Some citrus from the simcoe hops gives another dimension. Gotta try the Citra.

From tap at Uiltje Bar, Haarlem. Aroma is Bretty funk, fruity hops, citrussy notes with some lemon. Flavour is above moderate sour with some pleasant hoppy bitterness. Body is medium. Not as great as the Citra, but quite nice.
Pours clear blonde small white head. Smell is more woody, more earthy than the mosaic. Taste is Sharp, sour, dry, woody, bit more medicinal than the mosaic. Bit earthy, wet cloth aspects as well.

Aroma - must, barnyard, dry Simcoe hops.
Appearance - body is a hazy gold, with a 1/4" white head. With some good nucleation.
Taste - has a musty yeast, with some barnyard, Chardonnay qualities, and some tuned down dry Simcoe hops.
Palate - body is in the lighter side of medium, texture is vinuous, carbonation is average, the finish is dry.
Nicely dryhopped version of their spontan base lambic. A decent drinker, though not as bold as other versions I have had.

Tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Poured a very slightly hazy straw colour with a thin white head. The aroma is yeast, light biscuit malt, citrus. The flavour is moderate sour with a light crisp, dry, refreshing, acid, citrus fruit, light tart palate, medium to light bodied witn average carbonation.
Orange, small head, aroma of brett, hops, green, onion, sour flavor, bretty, hops, onion, lemony, green, tea, wood, medium bodied.

Bottle from private import. Aroma: strong floral and herbal aroma in a citrus juice. App: cloudy golden, small white head leaving little lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, resinous, herbs back in mouth, extremely dry acidity and bitter finish. Overall: as much as I enjoyed the Citra version, this one is a bit of a let down. Not bad per se but this herbal and floral is way to present. Also mouthfeel isnt that great. It goes from acidified to bitter in a few nanoseconds. Not bad but a bit too surprising and different.

Small format bottle poured into a belgian tulip. The beer is a hazed copper with a white head of foam. The aroma has notes of dried herbs, grassy, a bit of citrus. Earthy and herbal tartness. Mild sourness in the beer throughout. Dry finish. Medium body and medium carbonation.
Spritzig hopfig säuerlicher Antrunk. Vollmundig, hell, spritzig, langer hopfiger Nachhall. 10/11/11/11/11/11

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Sampled from 0.33 l bottle from Prik & Tik Baelus, best before April 2020. Slightly hazy, golden yellow with a white head. Sourish-fruity, slightly funky aroma of lemon, gooseberry, rhubarb, pineapple and some barnyard. Moderately sour, quite fruity and a bit funky taste of lemon, gooseberry, pineapple, rhubarb and some barnyard, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, moderately tart and quite dry finish. Thin to medium body, medium tart and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice!
33cl. Fast klare hell goldgelbe Farbe, geringe weiße schaumkrone. Geruch grasig hopfig, strauchig, leicht säuerlich. Geschmack leicht säuerlich malzig, citrusfrüchte, limetten, gut!

I had Centennial previously. I find Simcoe a tad dryer and more well balanced. The pour is golden orange with a toasted bread aroma, light acetic notes, a bit of fresh citrus fruit. Lemon peel and tart sour profile notes. There are light notes of grapefruit and a refreshing quality. The finish is dry and lingers for 5 or more seconds with a nice lingering tartness. Overall a delightful brew; both a crushable and sippable beer!

Bottle from Wine & Cheese. Pours translucent gold with a white head. Aroma is funky and arguably citrus. Med body. Flavor is citrus in a funky way bringing pineapple to mind. Maybe theres pine. Seems astringent. Rather tasty and drinkable brew.

330ml bottle pours a slightly hazy golden orange color with a finger of white head that settles down to reveal some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is lemon with some hints of wine grapes and funk. Taste is a lemon tartness with a light fruity and malty sweetness finishing quite dry and funky. Light bodied with nice carbonation. Overall, a well crafted brew with a nice blend of flavours and a nicely balanced body. Recommended.

On tap at RCBW 2016. Golden yellow colour. Small size white head. Spices, herbal notes, earthiness, citrusses, hints of berries in the aroma. Slightly sweet, skightly spicy, bit earthy beginning. Notes of berries in the middle. Slight sweetness, hints of berries in the end. Very interesting, suprisingly complex lambic.

October 1, 2015. Bottle at SBWF. 
Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and light funky with lychee, peach, lemon, grain, grass, barnyard, minerals. Taste is light sour fruity and funky. Finish is light sour, fruity and funky with lemon, grass, grain, oak, some barnyard notes. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.
Bottle 330 ml. Orange color. Sour aroma: fruit, hops, floral, homemade vinegar. Taste wildly, sour, slightly bitter, fruit, dry, original.

Hazy golden color, creamy off-white head. Fruity nose with melon, citrus, grapes, funky notes. Sour fruity taste, tart, red currants, grapes, lemon, dry finish, well balanced. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Tap @RCBF. Hazy golden color. Tiny size, white head, stays as a ring. Sour, leather, acidic and fruity in aroma. Leather, fruity, yeasty, farmhouse and sourish in taste. Watery and thin. Thin, but drinkable brew.

@Riga Craft Beer Fest on tap; you can really smell the Simcoe hops, lots of blackcurrant, very nice and interesting, but also morphing into the more catty area of it. Taste is more on the catty side, too much for my taste.
Less hops on nose than after tasting. Very refreshing, light tartness with some herbal bitterness. Lovely

Thank you for sharing! Sampled 330 ml. bottle @ Gents Bierfestival 2016. Hazy orange, citrus, little white head. Nose is massive dank, orange peel, strange mandarin, zest, funk, brett,.. Taste is juicy mandarin hop, zest, rich fruit, basic lemon, zest, lovely fruit, funk, bit raw, hay, Faintly watery in a fitting way. Favorite one between this one, Citra & Centennial. Biggest fruit expression, big hop, very fun. Nice stuff, very easy to drink.

No head left; clear orangey-golden beer. Very flowery, but also resiny. No trace of the Bretts - good! Sourish, sour oranges or mandoras. Lipsmacking acidity, acidthinning, light, refreshing. Best of the three, thanks to the Brettflavours being supressed.
Bottle at Gents Bierfestival. Sour, hoppy, citrus, very very pleasant. Lovely beer, too bad they make it so expensive.
How: bottle Appearance: cloudy yellow, tiny white head. aroma: lemon peel, tart berries, floral. Palate: light body, medium carbonation.
Cloudy yellow - nice lemony, grapefruit taste, some grassy hints. Good ballanced, loved the sourness of this brew. What I did not like, kind of a bile aftertaste.
Balanced sourness and happiness. Bret in taste. Simco is far in the distance but decent present in this kind of sour beer.

Zapach średnio intensywny, słód, cytrusy, przyprawy, stajnia, skóra. Kolor złoty, mętne. Piana średnio obfita, drobna, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku lekka słodycz, lekka kwaśność, średnia pełnia, cytrusy, zioła, słód, przyprawy, siano, stajnia. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie niskie.

Pours a cloudy gold colour with a frothy cream head. Noce fruity hop aroma with ctirus and brett. The taste is sharp, tart, zingy citrus and light spice to begin with before brett, braedy yeast notes and some trical hop bitterness.
Golden orange, funky fruity nose is a touch dank and moderately funky. Flavor is good balance of funk and acidity and hops
Tap Clear orange colour with small head.Aroma is dry and sour and flowery taste of nots of wood and berries good funky taste and nice well balanced and even good dry soure finish.

Lys brun lett tåkete med fingerhøyt offwhite skum. Sursyrlig lukt, blomster, syrlige epler og bæreddik. Middels fylde. Sur så det holder, sure grønne rips, stikkelsbær og grønne epler. Surheta sitter lenge.
Tåkete orange farge med luftig hvitt skum. Lukter syrlig eple og litt gjær. Smaker syrlig. Sitron og sure bær. Meget tørr og syrlig avslutning.
Aroma is tropical fruit, slightly pungent hops/Simcoe and lambic/funk. The flavor is fruit/berries/mild dark fruit, tropical fruit, slight earthiness, hops and a funky/slightly sugary finish.

Barwa złota, lekko zamglona. Piana całkiem obfita, redukuje się do cienkiej warstwy, która utrzymuje się do końca. W aromacie bardzo wyraźnie czuć stajnię, jest kwaśny, owocowy, czuć cytrynę, owoce tropikalne. W smaku kwaśność jest spora, dalej czuć stajnię, pojawia się więcej cytrusów, goryczka jest niska, ale przyjemnie grejfrutowa. Ciekawe piwo, Simcoe fajnie się tutaj wpasował.

From tap. Pours hazy light golden with almost no head. Aroma of thistle, herbs, almost some oregano notes, light stone fruit - especially apricot. Taste is heavy thistle, stone fruit, herbal and still with notes of oregano, quite juicy, a tad watery, grassy. I still prefer mosaic and citra in this series.
Fairly one-dimensional, could easily be hoppier. Nice sourness, but lacking character.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours a cloudy gold colour with a frothy cream head. Noce fruity hop aroma with ctirus and brett. The taste is sharp, tart, zingy citrus and light spice to begin with before brett, braedy yeast notes and some trical hop bitterness.

Draught at Mikkeller Barrel Room, Copenhagen. Slightly hazy orange colour. No head. Tart, fruity aroma with citrus fruits, bretts, barnyard, sour fruits, berries and funky notes. Taste is sour. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes sour with citrus fruits and lingering berries. High drinkablility in this one.
Smells like tart soap with slight funk in back. Hazy copper nice lasting head. Slightly perfume hop then then turn an earth tart and slowly fade lemony. A bit thin but delicious.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden, small white head, good lacing. Aroma is simcoe, line, passionfruit, hints of cat piss, lemon, lime, guava. Flavor is light tart, fruity, light funk. Medium body. Really good.
Dimmig orange öl med smutsvitt skum. Doft av citrus, maltsötma och brett. I smaken kommer syrligheten fram mer tillsammans med fruktighet i form av aprikos, bra balanserat med beskan.

330ml bottle from Brewdog shop. 
Thin white head, a little lacing. Hazy golden amber body. Nose is funky citrus, yeast. Flavour is tart gooseberry, bread, a bit lemon, grass. Tart berries on the finish, a bit chalky. Some lingering hop bitterness. Medium carbonation, dry puckering mouthfeel. Quite weird having a hoppy sour but it's good.
Bottle . Golden color, thick white frothy head. Aroma is fruity, lemony, lemon zest, earthy notes. Taste is medium tart, fruity, lemony, gooseberies, zesty and earthy. Dry and citric finish

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut! (7:3:6:3:13=3.2)
Beautiful apricotty aroma, gentle woody sourness. Light palate. Spicy taste, lots of citrus - grapefruit. Finish tangy. Lacking the sour bite Im after, and too young for the fuck too. Nice and fruity though.
Rerate: Tap (Riga Craft Beer Festival 2016) (4:3:4:2:9=2.2)
Smelly. Watery. Useless.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 Bottle shared by Mart. Clear golden yellow beer, small white head. Nose is lemony, dry, tart, citric, green apples. Flavor is dry and tart, apples, funk notes. Dry and lemony finish, dry and citric aftertaste, apple notes. Crisp carbonation.

Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours golden. Aroma is fruity, citrus, grapefruit, lemon. Flavor is sour and bitter, citrus, grapefruit, apricot. Finish is grapefruit bitter. Body is somewhat watery. Overall: ok.

Bottle thanks to Lorna. It pours hazy gold with a thick, foamy white head. The aroma is bready, cracker, straw, funk, sharp citrus vibe, grapefruit and piss. the taste is crisp, bright tartness, lemon zest, grapefruit, orange, sherbet, green apple, decent acidity, straw, funk and damp leaves with a firm, dry finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Bright and zesty. Rather nice gear.
Bottle. Pale yellow, clear liquid, not much of head. Smell of wet rag. Aroma of lemon, tin of hops. Light medium bitter. Far worse then Mosaic version, but still OK.
Tap at Taphouse. Amora of citrus, barnyard and Lemon with notes of Brett. Light fruity, Lactic and zesty. The flavour is mainly sour. The body is light and the texture is juicy. Soft carbonation.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar SF. Pours golden with a clinging white head and a citrus and toffee aroma. There is a fresh slightly sour pale malt flavor with a dry finish.
Bottle from Kihoskh. From the bottle but my guess is light cloudy golden pour with a tiny head. Notes of grapefruit, orange peel, subtle funk and some sticky pine.

golden, unclear orange, small white head, very citric hoppy aroma with sourness in the background, little funk, nice sourness, dry bitter finish, hops not so much in your face, funky brett dry finish with hops, very easy drinking,
Tap @ Mikkeller, Viktoriagade. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, lactose acid, fruits, hops and malt. Nice bitter and sour finish.

Pours foggy apricot with low white head 
Aromas tart and funky of apricot, citrusy fruits, hay, barnyard, spices 
Taste has notes of tart ripe apples, citrusy fruits, barnyard, grass, funk 
High carbonation, low sweetness, low bitterness, medium bodied
Draft. Hazy golden beer with a small to medium white head. Aroma is citra, horse, hops, slight malt. Flavour has a nice hoppy citrus taste a long with grass ending with a tart sour fruit taste.
From tap at Taphouse. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, sourness, yeast and spice.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - golden orange fuzzy pour with white head. Aroma and taste is medium sour fruity with some great tropical and citrus fruity notes, juicy, very nice balance of sourness, light tart on the palate, overall perry nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of brettanomyces, spices, and hops. The flavor is acidic with notes of brettanomyces, malt, spices, and hops, leading to a tart finish.
330 ml bottle at Dansken, Göteborg. hazy golden with thin white head. Sour lemon, berries, oak, zest and medium sourness. Dry, medium carbonation.

17/III/16 - 33cl bottle @ De Proefbrouwerij (Lochristi) - BB: 2/III/21 (2016-279) Thanks to Dirk for the excellent tour and samples!
Clear blond beer, small irregular white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of brett, typical geuze aroma, funky, horse blanket (neh). MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: citrus, bit sourish, lemon peel, kumquats, soft sourness. Aftertaste: lemony, bit of grapefruit, funky, brett, wild yeast, citrus.

Bottle-- Pours hasy golden with thin white head. Pleasant nose of preserved lemon and green apple. Aromas are lemon, grapefruit, apple, soem grassy hops. Average carbonation, medium body. Taste is tart and sour. Long sour, dry and lemony finish. Really great job!

bottle sample. poured a deep hazy golden pour with a fluffy white head. nose of sour lemons, funky apples, floral hops, chees, sweet passion fruits, nice and sour funk, grains, very nice and refreshing tart mouthfeel. the citra version is the best by far imo. Mikkel should keep his focus on the sour beers. amazed by these brews

Botella 33 cl tomada en el momento en Oviedo el 27..01..2015. (r74). Color ámbar tostado oscuro turbio con bastante espuma blanca. Perfecta combinación de ácidos con toques finales amargos ligeramente resinosos, incluso algo dulces afrutados. Imprescindible dentro del estilo. Cuerpo medio con gas y espumoso. Para repetir sin duda.

Hazy golden color with off-white head. Aroma is full-on lambic with some dank hoppy notes. Funky with hay, musty cellar and barnyard notes. Taste is not as funky but its tart, lemony, hoppy and fresh. Hops are not as present and aromatic as in the Citra and Mosaic versions. Body is light but smooth and the carbonation is soft, making it very drinkable. Sourness is also not very harsh. Overall its a very easy drinking and refreshing lambic style hoppy ale.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Mikkeller Spontandryhop Simcoe ].Light unclear matt medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, pale malt, moderate hoppy, citrus, moderate yeasty, barnyard, leather - brett. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, light to moderate acidic and moderate bitter with a long duration, mandarin, tart, citrus, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20151123]

330ml bottle many thanks to Saeglophur (European secret summer santa 2015)
Appearance: yellow hazy color, with a small white head. 
Aroma: Fruity, funk, green apples, also exotic fruits. 
Taste: Acidic, Citric, sour, funk, sour apples, almonds, grass, light herbs. finishes quite dry sour citric. quite nice, 
light to medium body, bubbly carbonation, slick mouthfeel.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar Victoriagade. Pours hazy golden with a creamy frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some sticky lacing on the glass. Semll is fruity and funky with crackers, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, mango, moist grass, pine needles, leather, horse blanket, minerals, barnyard and lemon zest. Taste is sour, fruity, grassy and funky. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is sour with buttered crackers, grapefruit juice, lime juice, mango, moist grass, pine needles, dry soil, barnyard, horse blanket, leather and lemon zest. Needs to lose the butter but except for that this is a great hoppy sour.
Amesome lambic, features nice fruity acidity (citrus) with notes of hay, hops, yeast. Sourness is fairly balanced with a touch of sweet.

33cl bottle from Beer Gonzo. It pours a lightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is intensely funky and tart, with notes of lemon apricots horse blanket grass and lactic acid. Taste is tart and acidic with more lemon juice and apricots, grass basement funk and yoghurt acidity. Light body with lively carbonation. Overall, excellent

Gylden uklar skum hvid luftig 
Citrus mandria humle eddike stald 
Sur modrate 
Blød oile 
@f1

330 ml bottle at All Star Västerås. Golden with little head. Aroma is sour, funky and hoppy, very pleasant and dominated by the lambic, not too much hops. Taste was exactly what I was expecting, a dry hopped lambic with notes of hay, grass, citrus peel and hops.

33 cl. BB 02/04/20. Un liquide blond pâle avec une mousse qui sefface rapidement. Un nez intense de fruits exotiques, de pêche, de bois et de levure sauvage. Une bouche sèche avec des fruits exotiques aussi. Une finale longue et savoureuse.

Bottle. Hazy glowing gold pour with thin creamy white head. Aroma is really nice, sweet lemony notes, earl grey tea, citrusy, mild lactic notes, lots of hay, beautiful grassy notes. Taste is acidic, sharp lemony acidity with a touch of lactic acid, light grassiness. Palate is bone dry, light with strong carbonation. Very tasty.
Halm gul, vitt skum. Doft: Funk, ny skurat golv, gammal såg verkstad, lite rabarber. Smak: Jordkällaren, funk, citrus skal, malt, bröd jäst, rabarber, humle.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2015 330mL bottle, pours a cloudy bright orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out lovely floral dry hopping and light barnyard funk. Flavour is similar, with a great mix of barnyard funk and floral dry hopping. Perhaps a tad less abrasive on the hopping compared to the Mosaic and Citra, but all three are pretty similar. Complex and highly drinkable, though I prefer the other two versions. Excellent.

pours unclear very nice golden with a small creamy white head, reviving and leaving nice lacing. golden raisins, grape-infused lambic, green spicy simcoe features, tropical fruits, medium acidity - complex flora, spicy wheat. moderate carbonation - tad loose, light body, pleasantly tart yet somewhat tannic and spicy-citrusy finish. good stuff.

Pours a tiny bit hazy and golden with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of grapefruit, passion fruit, other sour fruits, weed. Taste is also nicely juicy a moderate tartness. Some cereals pierce through that lactic barrier but not too much. Grassy hops, dank. Drinks almost like a carbonated citrus juice. Body is light to medium, carbonation moderately high and it is incredibly refreshing. This sour IPA/dryhopped sour thing is pretty neat, cant wait to see how it evolves into the future!

At Mikkeller bar Stockholm, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, sour.
TASTE: hoppy, fruity, sour, fresh, amazing!

33 cl. BB 02/04/20. Une blonde sans grande tête qui laisse, malgré tout, de belles traces. Un nez très parfumé, fort en agrumes et en fruits exotiques, en bois et en sueur de femme sucrée. Au goût, une explosion, littéralement, de pamplemousses et de divers agrumes sur un fond aimable de lambic. En bouche, voilà un corps huileux avec des bulles vivantes. En finale, sécheresse de fruits acidulés et de spontanéité. Très bon jus. Jen veux une caisse.
Sample at SBWF 2015. Hazy golden body with a white head. Citrus, tropical fruit, barnyard.

How: Bottle (330 ml) at home. 

>>> Highly enjoyable hoppy [gently] sour with a flavor profile dominated by citrus/orange and backed by some nice funk. Lovely.

-  Cloudy orangey with a medium white head, medium retention and some lacing. 
-  Theres a burst of citrus and passionfruit carried by a mild to moderate acidity. 
-  The hoppiness is gentle, but fits really well with the citrus profile. 
-  Theres a mild but interesting funk presence in the background along a touch of buttery oak (not in a bad way). 
-  Body is medium, carbonation is moderate and the finish is rather dry. 
-  Super easily drinkable and quenching despite/because of the sourness. 

Flavors:  Citrus/orange (lots), passionfruits, mild funk, buttery oak, mild herbalness.

Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Hazy golden with a bubbly head. Barnyard cheesy funk with vinegar and tart lemon. Grapefruit and lime with underlying mango and peach sweetness. Yeasty with a woody dry finish. Very good.

Je dois avouer que javais commandée cette bière sans vraiment me rendre compte quil sagissait dune bière sûre! Au nez, jai donc lâché un "wow!" plutôt surpris. Je croyais en fait avoir affaire à une IPA houblonnée à froid. Une fois la surprise passée, donc, je me rendi compte dun nez sûre, fruité et, ma foi, très agréable. En bouche, je regrette officiellement de ne pas en voir achetée davantage... Cest un style qui tombe totalement dans mes cordes! Peut-être légèrement trop mince, lidée est toutefois définitivement là: une bière sûre, fruitée et fraiche : clémentines et mandarines me viennent à lesprit. À laveugle, javoue que je naurais pas deviné le dry hopping, mais je sens quil peut en effet être un des ingrédients participant à cette réussite. Jaime beaucoup!

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, barnyard and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 180815

0,25 l on tap at the Mikkeller Bar Copenhagen. Unclear gold amber in the glass, small head. Taste ist dry sourfruity, grapefruit, apple and I think blueberry with a pleasant sourness and bitterness. All in a hoppy bedding. Little bit oily. Longlasting dry aftertaste. Really nice one.

330ml bottle from Mikkeller webshop. Pours an orangey golden colour with a white foam head. Aroma of funk, lemony citric, hint of dank hop.Taste is sour, citrus rind, grain, barnyard, hay, plus some fruity hop notes and light bitterness. Slick mouthfeel, medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry tart sour finish. Very drinkable.
Bottle. Aroma of barnyard, funky, tart fruits, citrus. In the flavour citrus, tart fruits, funky notes. Medium to high sourness, high carbonation. Very nice beer but no signs ofsimcoe in my bottle.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 Hazy orange color, big white head but quickly disappear. Aroma is barnyard, leather, lemon, acidic pine and hint of sweet tropical fruits. Taste is medium sour, light bitter and dry. Flavor of lemon, ripe red grapefruit, leather. Aftertaste is long tartness and bitterness.

Draught beer hazy golden appearance with white head The initial Aroma is sour with some citrus in the background The taste is initially sour with grapefruit and citrus notes coming through very refreshing on the palate almost effervesant Leaves a refreshing bitterness on the palate A very interesting beer struggled to get much Simcoe though Try it if you can you will not be disappointed.

Bottle
Aroma-barnyard, mango,vanilla, 
Appearance-pale, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, sour finish
Overall-very refreshing

330 ml bottle from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Amber, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, slightly yellow head.
Aroma of barnyard, sour citrus, apples, lemongrass, apricot, some berries.
Taste is sour, dry, with sour citrus, sweet-sour apples, pears, grass, barnyard, subtle sweet fruits.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes sour, quite dry, with pears, apples, citrus.

Very nice. Straight, but still quite complex and very well balanced, with interesting sweet-sour fruit notes. Not my favourite from the 3 Spontandryhop beers, but not so different to the other ones.

330ml bottle at home shared by Saeglopur, many thanks. yellow hazy color, small white head. smells fruity, funk, green apples, cherries, also exotic fruits. light to medium body, bubbly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, acidic, sour, funk, sour apples, almonds, grass, light herbs. finishes quite dry with citric and sour notes. quite nice, tried this together with the Mosaic Edition and Mosaic was almost a touch more fruity, overall both quite nice.

03.05.2015, tap @ Mikkeller Bar:
26.06.2015, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry fruity, citrus peel, leafs, lemon, sorrel, oak, fresh hops, dried fruits, grapefruit, minerals. Taste is sour-ish dry, soda powder, citrus acid, sorrel, citrus peel, weeds, rope, oak, fresh hops, lemon, minerals. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry citrusy mouthfeel. Nice one.
Sour aroma of grapefruit & citrus. Clear golden with small white head. Well balanced sourness with a dry finish. Light body, sticky texture & average carbonation.

Fat på Bishop Gustav, Malmö. Riktigt torr, uppfriskande och citrussyrlig. Humlen funkar riktigt bra. Lite funkig och med mycket grön lätt omogen syrlig frukt typ krusbär, äpplen, kiwi och citrus - tack Daniel.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are lemon, funk and wood - with a dry finish.
Really fantastic sour beer, just a hint of funk on the nose, tongue numbing sourness, then a gentle hop finish to clean up. Fantastic .

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.

-Aroma: very strong citrus smell akin to grapefruit

-Appearance: light yellow, almost straw colored, and slightly hazy, thin white head

-Taste: heavy sour, crisp, taste of green apples, lingering tart

-Palate: medium body with coarse carbonation

-Overall: surprisingly sour, I expected more bitterness and hop, but was pleasantly surprised by the sour fruit.

Keg @ BD Sheps. Slightly hazy burnt orange color with an eggshell white head. Nice summery nose. Dirty flower patch. Pine forest and pacific trade wind. Musty grape and funk. Taste is pleasingly dry. Delicate mandarin citrus. Pine needle. Brett tang. Salty driftwood. Light and zippy. Excellent, really. If this was made by SARA or Side Project, people would be losing their minds. Instead, its made by Mikkeller, so Im sure people will find ways of disparaging it.
Pours hazy golden with a finger of white head. Aroma of green grapes, light bretta, citrus. Taste is rich tart fruity with mellow sweet finish. Light and crisp body with average carbonation.

W zapachu glownie simcoe, lekkie nuty cytrusowe, żywiczne. W smaku kwas, wyrazne nuty winne, lecz amerykanskie chmiele bardzo dobrze wpasowuja sie do tego stylu, tworząc ciekawe polaczenie. Kolor złoty, lekko zamglony. Srednie wysycenie, dobra pijalnosc.Podsumowujac ciekawe nowofalowe połaczenie klasycznego stylu w wykonanku swietnego browaru Mikkeller
Cest très acide et "crisp" comme il dise .... Normalement, ce nest pas vraiment mon type de bière, mais cela sest révélé très désaltérant ...

Bottle at home.
Clear amber colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of hops and pine needles with notes of tea and citrus.
Light acidic flavor of citrus, oak and hops.
Tart finish.

On tap at Kulturhuset. Hazy light orange colour with no head. Aroma is classic limbic with notes of tropical fruits. Flavour is more sweet than bitter. Notes of Brett, but very well balanced. Citrus and assorted tropical fruits but also Brett and classic lambic notes. Short aftertaste. Surprisingly good actually.

Draught at The Rover, Göteborg. Hazy golden/orange beer with a nice offwhite head. Sour rubber aroma, grapefruit, grass, citrus, leather, barnyard notes. Sourish citrus and rubber flavor, rubber, barnyard, grass, pine, mango, herbal, some hay. Very good, Iblike the hops added to a sour beer.

Fat på Bishop Gustav, Malmö. Riktigt torr, uppfriskande och citrussyrlig. Humlen funkar riktigt bra. Lite funkig och med mycket grön lätt omogen syrlig frukt typ krusbär, äpplen, kiwi och citrus. Gott.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Hazy golden with a white head. Great funky aroma, sweaty, oaky, with some fruity hops. Sour and refreshing flavor, funky, oaky, lemony, with some fruity hops and a bitterish note. Medium-bodied. Really good.
330ml bottle from cornelius. Pours hazy golden, thin white head. Aromas of sherbet, orange flower. Taste is light sour, grapefruit juice. Sour finish.

Pours a hazy orange with a low white head. Aromas of funk, orange, citrus, kiwi and gooseberry. Taste is orange, citrus, funk, kiwi and gooseberry. Mouthfeel is lively with medium carbonation and medium body.

33cl bottle at cerveteca lisboa, portugal. Color is orange. Appearance is clear. Head is thin and white. Taste is medium to high sour, light sweet. Aroma is apple, citric, hoppy, brett, grassy, woody, pineapple.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Bottle. Hazy amber pour with white head. Aroma has cat piss and sour yeasty notes. Taste is very fresh with citrus. High carbonation. Very balanced. Rerated September 2016

(330ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, May 21 2015) Pours hazed medium gold with small white head and lace. A sweet/tart orange and grapefruit nose with some funky barnyard notes, green apple and a little yeast and vinegar. Palate has citrus mix to the fore with a bit of leafy hops but not very dank, some sour green apple in the middle, barnyard Brett light but present, some hop bitterness building towards the finish. Finish is dry, with a light-moderate hop bitterness and some grain. Medium bodied with above average carbonation. This doesnt really pop like the Citra version, its nice but more straightforward in its hop character. That dies a little by the finish as well. Its quite nice and mostly pales in direct comparison to that other version, but maybe the hop wasnt as suited to the beer.
Końska derka, koci mocz w aromacie. Świetna, konkretna kwasowość z solidną podbudową chmielowo-słodową. Mocna rzecz. Warte powtórzenia.
33 cl bottle. Pours cloudy yellow, huge white head. Aroma is dry barnyard, citric. Crisp sour and hoppy citric flavoured. Lingering cridp citric and dry barnyard finish.
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma is funky, sharp, fruity, floral and slightly perfumed. Taste is funky, little plastic but not unpleasant, fruity sweets, floral. Dry and sour. A lot going on
Bottle. Hazy golden with a medium white head. Tart, funk, citrus, cork, hops, yeast. Lots of tart funky citrus in the flavour. Citric finish. Very drinkable.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, København
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, funk, tart and citrus. Taste is light sweet and heavy sour with a long dry, sour, citrus and grape finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours a clear golden yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is tart, citrus, sour fruity notes, light tropical notes, some unripe fruits such as tart apples and pears, gooseberries. Vinegar and oaky notes in there aswell. Taste is pretty hoppy, lots of fruit, green grapes, apples, citrus, vinegar, oak.

Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear golden with a medium sized, white head. Aroma is very tart, citric sour, vinegar, oak, grass, hops, unripe pear, peach. Taste is very juicy, but with oaky vanilla and green grapes without being very dry. Sour and citric, but mellow and hoppy. Smooth body and average carbonation.

Tap. Hazy golden body with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, apricot funk and yeast. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry, bitter and quite tart, Light to medium bodied, watery texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Sour. 🌟🌟🌟🌟
Overall: Good sourness, grapefruit, rhubarbs, pineapple. Dry.Note: Bottle 330 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2015-05-16.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2016 On tap at Christian Firtal Pale Ale Festival. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Funky aroma with citrus and pine and a a hint of biscuit/toffee. Dry and tart flavour with citrus and grass, and jonge lambik popcorn character. July 2016,  tastes finished, uprated 0.5
Tap @ C4 Pale Ale Festival , 2015. Pours Hazy golden with a white head. Hoppy and tart flavor with a bit of late popcorn. A shame. Sticky bitter and dry finish!

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sour, tart fruity, funky, leather, yeast, wet wood, fresh fruity hops, tropical fruit, tangarine, citrus. Flavor is sour, tart fruit, yeast, leather, wood, big juicy tropical fruit, leather, citrus, tangarine, peach, grapefruit, lemonpeel. Medium body, soft carbonation, dry and rather acidic finish. Lovely. 150515

Draft @ Taproom, Malmö. Pours a slightly hazy golden pale orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour weak funky citrus aroma. Fruity sour tart funky bitter citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour tart funky citrus finish.

Tap @ fermentoren Aarhus. Pours hazy orange amber with a white head. Aroma of nice fresh citrusy hops, some yogurt-like lactic notes, sour citrus fruits, funk and weak goose berries. The taste is funky, dry and lactic with notes of sour green currants, some bitter hop notes and some floral notes. Very nice and refreshing!

pour cloudy pale with a small white head. green apple aromas, taste medium sour. light palate with a fine sour finish 

fine sour, easy to drink

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus, 5.5%. Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, tart, sour, hops, pine and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, tart, lemon, baking yeast, hops, little sweet, dry, sour, tart, citric, little grapefruit and medium bitter.

Tap. Pours clear golden with one finger white head. Aroma is funky, tart, citrus, hops, slight grass, white grapes, barnyard, dry, oak, unripe pear and peach. Taste is sweet, yeast, funky fruits, white grapes, grape, hops, citrus. Complex and some sour white wine notes. Full body with dry oak-like finish. Some bitterness and stil really juicy. Lot of taste for the low ABV! Well done.

Bottle at home. Clear wood/golden - white head. Rather high sourness. Nice wooden. Sharp bitterness. Grape fruits. Goose berries. Sweet wood. Resin. High citric. Earthy notes. Lovely - high drinkability.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden amber pour with a frothy off white head, big fresh orange juice aroma with a hint of funk, taste has fresh zesty orange, some peach, a hint of grape, some funk.

Keg at Mikkeller Bar, Vik, 03/05/15.
Lightly hazed orange golden with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is funk, straw, pissy tingess, lemon rinf, light hop strokes.
Taste comprises tangy orange rinds, apricot, pissy citrics, damp hay, lemon rind, funky tones.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, tarte fruit wash and hop tones in the close.
Decent hopped up sour affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 

Pours orange with a smooth head. Aroma of juicy fruits, tropical notes, tart lemon, citrus, grapefruit and mild sourness. Taste is sour, sweetish and slightly tart with some fruits and citrus. Finish is smooth, sweetish and slightly sour with some tart fruits. Okay.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.
Rated on 20150503.
Pours hazy orange color with a small head. Rowan berries on the nose, some gooseberries to, mild hops and sour apricot. Sour apricot flavor with gooseberries and some spicy notes, grapefruits too. Refreshing.
3435

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar. Rated on 03.05.2015. Aroma has earthy notes and grapefruit. Also mild milky notes. Flavour has strong grapefruit tones, earthy notes and hints of milk. Leathery finish. Nice, could not locate the simcoe though.
Hazy amber.. Thin white lacing.... Soft funk fruit nose... Tart zezty funk fruit.. Light funk
